feedback.Physical object: Included — A self-contained physical device typically placed on a surface.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Included — Fully designed and manufactured by humans.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — Not derived from or mimicking biological systems.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Intended to remain in a fixed location (e.g., nightstand).
feedback.Structural: Included — Display, buttons, and casing are mechanically integrated.
feedback.Perceptible: Included — User interacts with its sounds, lights, and visual time display.
feedback.Material form: Included — Composed of plastics, electronics, and visible screens.
feedback.Passive: Excluded — Outputs sounds and light, and performs logic-driven behavior.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Included — Engineered to track time and wake users.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Included — Produces audible alarms and visual indicators.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Included — Follows programmed timing and alarm logic.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Included — Allows setting and changing alarm and time values.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Included — Requires user input to set and operate.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Excluded — Typically standalone, not integrated into broader systems.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Excluded — Needs initial setup and operates on schedule.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — Auxiliary device, not essential for broader operations.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — Displays numeric time but not symbolically expressive.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — Delivers alerts, but not symbolic or dialogic communication.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Included — Uses internal logic to trigger alarms and manage display.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Simple architecture, not abstractly modular.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — May shape routine, but not functionally guiding behavior.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — Does not reflect on its own operation.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Tracks and responds to linear time.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Operates uniformly regardless of environment.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Functionally consistent across contexts and not socially constructed.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — Product-defined, not by social or institutional consensus.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — Minimal regulation beyond safety standards.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — Teachable, but not itself a transmissible semantic unit.
feedback.Visible: Included — Designed to be prominently displayed.

encoding_notes: This encoding captures the digital alarm clock as a physical, standalone device that fulfills timekeeping and alert functions. Its traits are concentrated in the physical and functional layers, with modest abstraction (rule-based and temporal) and socially relevant visibility. Social constructs and symbolic communication are excluded due to its direct, utilitarian design.
